website_summaries.verdict: Split wood pieces measuring up to 9 inches in diameter with this extra-large cast iron kindling splitter.
pros: Makes kindling without handling a sharp blade
Place firewood inside iron safety ring and strike with blunt object to drive wood onto splitting wedge
Makes it possible for almost anyone to split kindling
cons: Works best with softer woods already smaller than 9 inches in diameter

customer_reviews.title: Easy work
customer_reviews.text: i have been thinking about buying this for a while but was holding back because it seemed overpriced. I'm very impressed with it. The design works really well and it's so much easier to make smaller pieces. It can split some good size logs and so far I'm very happy with the purchase. I also bought the fiskars 4lb hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Easier, faster and safer way to split kindling
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my dad for Christmas so he could stop whacking his fingers and losing his fingernails as a result. He loves it! The young lady who invented this is a genius. My dad says he really likes using it, and that it has made chopping kindling much easier and safer. He's been chopping wood for about 40 years now, so it's pretty significant for him to try a new way of doing things and actually like it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Clegg

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: We heat our home with wood, and as you can imagine, this requires a lot of wood splitting. I bought this for my husband thinking it might make splitting kindling a bit easier for him. It's made it easier for us both! From splitting kindling to splitting larger pieces of wood, this gets the job done. I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Corinia

customer_reviews.title: Split em
customer_reviews.text: Get a 4 lb hammer, larger model of this is worth the extra cost. I have both use the small one for really fine kindling making but the large would work for that also. Also this the the original and get the original it is worth every penny if you like to build fires. Final note if you have knotty pine to split cut your logs between branches as much as possible. Knots impact any splitting device, but will impact this type more. Any Straight grained wood will split great with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Addition To Your Wood Inventory
customer_reviews.text: This did not start off as I'd expected, which was that I was going to be able to split split logs. While, in some cases, that's possible, it's definitely got greater facility with already-quartered or halved pieces and it makes super great starter (not splinters) kindling. As a side benefit, it's fantastic at getting your frustrations out after you've gotten too many junk-phone-calls and you want to kill something. Awesome! I don't think you would be allowed to manufacture and sell this in the US but...someone! Prove me wrong! Why did I have to get it from Australia?
customer_reviews.author: Bill Heppe

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use with a 4 lb hammer. You can make your kindling as small as you want. Only time I've had any difficulty is with knots. Highly recommend. 👍
customer_reviews.author: HunterJumpergrl

customer_reviews.title: Kindling Cracker King
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy duty, sturdy and sharp and can be sharpened If need be. We actually used it to cut wood into smaller pieces, not necessarily kindling. As with anything some woods will cut easier than others but it just depends on what you are cutting. Get the XL to make sure you get something big enough. We are using this wood in a Meal Master wood kitchen cook stove. The fire box isn't that big and it is perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This device is actually one of the best investments I’ve ever made when it comes to dealing ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is actually one of the best investments I’ve ever made when it comes to dealing with firewood. My aim with an axe is not all that good. This tool allows me to cut kindling without having to worry about that at all. It also makes the most satisfying metallic pink every time I cut a piece of kindling, much like a ding on a slot machine. It is easy to use and very safe.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald A. Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this sooner!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 10-stars, I would. It just arrived today and I put it to work immediately. For larger pieces I recommend you split with a maul first. Other than that, I don't know why I didn't by this sooner! I filled a 20-gallon tote with five pieces of wood in about 15-minutes. Works really, really well! One last piece of advice, make sure you use at least a three pound hammer with a longer handle. Think framing hammer handle length.
customer_reviews.author: NJM

customer_reviews.title: Works great for kindling
customer_reviews.text: When used with a 3 or 4 pound sledge it is very efficient is producing kindling. Although the XL size accommodates larger logs, depending on your wood type it can be tough to split larger logs, and it requires multiple hits. But for smaller logs and kindling it works wonders. I have been sharpening mine with the small sharpening puck meant for axes, and that seems to be working well (watch your fingers!). I'm guessing a small handheld Stihl axe sharpener, or something like it, would work great too with less risk of cutting yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Dabu

customer_reviews.title: A helluva tool
customer_reviews.text: Making kindling from split logs has always been a difficult job for me. Maybe it's because I burn piñon and live oak, but trying to make kindling with a hand axe is a pain and sometimes dangerous to one's fingers, eyes, etc. This splitter is marvelous! Very sharp blade, very solid (heavy cast iron). I have found that attaching it to a board to stabilize it is necessary. So far, I have not found one log I haven't been able to split with my 4 lb. mallet in just a few strokes! An excellent design, with the top ring positioned so that it is almost impossible to strike the splitting blade with the mallet. A fabulous design!
customer_reviews.author: KLS

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Today - Love It Already!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5’6” tall woman, 61 years old, and I can easily split kindling with this tool. My husband had a big log ready and waiting for mounting, about 18” high. Now that it’s mounted we can see that is really too tall (for me), so he’s going to cut that mounting block down to about 8”. Then I won’t have to start the arc of my striking hammer quite so high. But the blade on the splitter is nice and sharp, and even a wimp like me can split kindling quickly and easily! This tool is going to be a worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best presents I’ve ordered for myself in years! I get a couple cord delivered every year and there’s never quite the right mix of smaller pieces. I’m a bit nervous using an ax, so I decided to give this a try based on the reviews. Boy, am I glad I got this! I got the larger size, which I’d recommend to others. I use a four lb sledge with a 14” handle. I can split most pieces in four or five strikes. I feel very safe using it.
customer_reviews.author: HansC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool. Wish I had bought this large size earlier
customer_reviews.text: Can't live without it! It makes splitting wood into kindle so fast and easy. Makes fires is such a small task. I wish I had purchased this larger one to start with. I bought the smaller a few months ago, only to find out that many of the logs wouldn't fit in it. This one does the job, and I hardly ever need to use the smaller. Wish I had not paid for both - a waste on money on the smaller one. Not cheap either.
customer_reviews.author: vivie

customer_reviews.title: Best Firewood Splitter
customer_reviews.text: This is the larger version. I liked the smaller one so much I had to try the bigger one. BEST FIREWOOD SPITTER EVER. I love that it holds the log up. The recommended maul is 4lbs but I find the 6lb does a better job on the bigger logs. We use this constantly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Verber

customer_reviews.title: Essential for splitting logs into smaller logs and kindling
customer_reviews.text: I have the smaller size and loved it, so I also bought the larger one, which works just as well. Safe enough for a responsible child to use, much safer than mauls or accesses. Extremely easy to use. I would guess that it reduces my job time by about 70 percent, mostly because you can't miss with this. It's not inexpensive but worth every penny in time and effort saved. Very well made and incredibly durable. The larger one is fairly heavy compared to the smaller version, so keep this in mind if you are decided between the two. I've bought these as gifts, and every recipient has thanked me repetitively over the years.
customer_reviews.author: fanofhistory

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!! $$
customer_reviews.text: I can’t give this any higher rating. For anyone that can swing a sledge hammer it’s perfect. I have carpal tunnel and not the best with an axe, so this is a great tool for everyone. It makes splitting wood for kindling SO much easier. It braces ur wood and makes aiming a lot easier. Probably the best purchase I’ve made ever. So much safer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Willard

customer_reviews.title: 10 Stars would be more appropriate!
customer_reviews.text: Believe the hype! I wish I knew about this item a long time ago. Effortless way to make not only kindling, but to break down already split wood into perfect size for my wood fireplace insert, and it's fun! Great product, highly recommended for veteran wood burners, if you don't have one, you want one of these. And thanks to amazon, got a great price on the xl size which accepts 9" logs 👍
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely amazing. It’s held up great for the past month. It’s so easy to use, I love it. When the logs are whole, it takes mane about 20 taps with an 8 lb ax, sometimes it takes a little work, but once plot, it slices the logs like butter, one, two, maybe 3 taps and it splits. Incredible item. I love it. Takes the work out of splitting wood, actually makes it fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a hand ax it is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.text: I do not usually write reviews but I felt compelled to for this piece of equipment. This thing is so much better than a hand ax it is ridiculous. It splits through the toughest knots, and hardwood pieces so easily it is laughable. You never have to worry about getting the size of kindling you want because you can easily place the wood exactly where you want it split. If you are splitting a lot of wood manually, and you aren't buying one of these you are doing it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Brown

customer_reviews.title: A game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I can make a tub full of small splits in 5 minutes with this thing. I have bought two of them, one for me and one for my son. We cook BBQ on wood fired pits along with burning wood in fire pits/rings. This is so much safer than trying to make small splits and splinters using an axe. There's simply no comparison! I will buy another for my camp when the pricing goes back down to the level I bought one at 3 months ago. The price seems to be a bit variable!
customer_reviews.author: Alphonse

customer_reviews.title: You will love it
customer_reviews.text: Might seem a bit pricey to you but if you are someone who needs to create kindling on an ongoing basis this is worth the money. I mounted mine on an 18 inch tree round and this is the only way I make kindling now. The XL size can handle some fairly large pieces so anything I have under 4-6 inches gets split on this. Don't recommend using another piece of wood for the 'striker' as there is too much vibration. Grab yourself a 5 pound sledge instead.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, makes quartering hardwood easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought the King. Well I'm about a month in and chewed through maybe a 1/2 cord with this and so far no hold-ups or issues. Maple, Ash and some hickory. For the 1/2 log quartering I have resorted to a 4 full sledge as opposed to a hand sledge to handle the chunks. 2 swings is usually all it takes ....just avoid the knotty ones or waved chunks. This is worth the price and is a quality cast.Don't settlefor the cheap knock-offs
customer_reviews.author: Digital Nomad IL

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Cracker King size reviewed
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of using a hatchet in the house,for kindling.I found a YouTube video and thought I would give it a try. So I ordered the large size. I move it in and out of the house and usually split two wheel barrow loads in 15 minutes of so.if your wood is 18-20 inches or so order the standard size.the stand is notched so you can attach it to a round with lag bolts. A 2 or 4 pound sledge with a 14 inch handle gives you plenty of power.It is cast iron just don’t leave it outside. Note: It does not handle knotted wood well I usually pass on them.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for all our kindling since it got here. WOW! It's faster and much safer than splitting with just a hand axe. I mounted it to a 14" high log. Lower would be a bit easier for max length logs, but it's what was in the wood yard. I'm using a 4lb hand sledge that seems just about right for the cedar and pine I use for kindling. I got the larger size Kindling Cracker and I'm glad I did. It accepts most of our split firewood. The smaller size wouldn't.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Tim

customer_reviews.title: Handy and worth the money! Anyone with a fireplace or woodstove can use this.
customer_reviews.text: This works so much better than I thought it would! Holds most pieces easily, so no more 'hit, falls over, stand it back up, repeat". Great for splitting odd shaped pieces, too. I bought the largest size available, and I would be happy if they made an even larger one, as some pieces do not fit inside. Sturdy, I did not attach it to anything, just use it on level ground. Love it so much I just bought one for my sister. :)
customer_reviews.author: bowlingmom

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the beginning of winter to use for creating kindling wood for my fireplace insert, has time went on I found myself splitting whole pieces of wood in half just for the ease of loading the insert. This is a well made sturdy wood splitting fixture whether you want kindling or just one split farther for your firewood. I used a 5 lbs. sledge hammer with this unit and found it to up to task splitting almost all of the pieces I tried to split.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product, with an awesome distributor!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE! The company in New Zealand was unresponsive and very arrogant. Telling me what happened didn't. Now, Northern Tool here in the US was awesome. They did listen and understand my situation and immediately sent out a new product, no questions asked. Thank you Ryan at Northern Tool. This is an awesome product and Northern Tool has my support!
customer_reviews.author: munk

customer_reviews.title: Safe and very efficient wood splitter.
customer_reviews.text: You need an 8 pound sledge hammer to but usually 3 hits are sufficient to split an 8-inch log. It is heavy enough that you don’t need to screw it down. In 15 minutes, you can usually split enough logs for 24 hours of burning in a woods stove. I keep it inside the house and just carry the splitter and an 8-pound hammer to the wood shed, put it on a stone path, and split 5-8 logs.
customer_reviews.author: Wise Young

customer_reviews.title: Great Kindling Maker
customer_reviews.text: After years of chopping kindling with a hatchet, I wanted a simpler / safer alternative. I purchased the Kindling Cracker King after reading reviews and couldn't be happier with it. It made short work of elm and oak logs, and I easily cut them into useful sizes, using a short mallet. The Kindling Cracker is light enough for me (female, senior citizen) to handle, but nevertheless feels very sturdy. Expect and hope it will remain a useful (and durable) part of my wood handling equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Litchfield Mz

customer_reviews.title: Got the big one, and still not tall enough.
customer_reviews.text: They guy I buy my wood from is not real precise. He goes 14 to 18", but on those where I need a little more room to split all the way to the end of the wood, I have have to turn the wood over to finish the job. The mouth is plenty big and handles a good size piece, but the height needs a bit more to it.
customer_reviews.author: CatCreekJim

customer_reviews.title: THE MOST USEFUL ITEM I HAVE EVER PURCHASED ON AMAZON!!!
customer_reviews.text: You will laugh, I figured I could get my butt in shape by chopping wood, but this is so easy to use, I may need to actually exercise. It took me under an hour to split 1/2 a cord of wood, and the only reason it took that long, is the stacking, and unstacking. I bought a full-size pound sledge, I like to swing, versus using a 4- 5 lb mallet as recommended. All you do with these splitters is load, wack a couple of times and its done.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Zombie Prepper

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to split wood.
customer_reviews.text: This works great! We have a fire pit and the split wood seems to burn much better. Just a few minutes and I have enough split wood to last several hours. Very well made and durable. For splitting smaller stuff this is the trick! It does work better if you mount it on something solid rather than sitting it on the ground. It's kind of fun actually. The neighborhood guys come over and want to try it...so I don't have to do a lot.
customer_reviews.author: RC Flyer

customer_reviews.title: If you have to split wood, YOU HAVE TO HAVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: It may seem like a lot of money at first, but this product is worth every penny! It is solidly built and incredibly easy, even if you aren’t very strong. If you are stronger, it is a piece of cake to split a dozen large pieces of wood into a big box full of kindling. Regardless of your physical ability, using the Kindling Cracker IS FUN! You will need a small sledge hammer or mallet. A regular hammer may work, but I didn’t try it. I wish we could show my wife and I using it. Very fun!
customer_reviews.author: Todd S. Avery

customer_reviews.title: Kindlin' Crackin' Great!
customer_reviews.text: Used for making kindling for my wood stove. Works well even with a 3 lbs. hammer instead of the recommended 4 pounder. Comes with a cheesy plastic piece to mount to your chopping block that the kindling cracker is supposed to then clip into. Did not use it; just stood the kindling cracker on the chopping block and re-centered it once in a while. It will invariably "walk" about when it gets used. What used to take up to 2 hours to do is down to about an hour. It's makes a drudge-worthy job quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky G.

customer_reviews.title: Fires starting much better now.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to cut kindling for a fireplace. Shorter, dry wood does cut easier. I use a 4 pound hammer. I have seen videos of people getting better results, but I blame my bad wood. I think the product is very good. It is way far better than when I tried using a splitting maul. I recommend you use the larger one unless your wood is more than 12 inches long.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Saves your fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I waited for the price to drop, it did, so I purchased one. A great purchase indeed. But only after watching a safety video on how people lose fingers when splitting kindling. Don't lose your fingers, buy one of these units and a 4 or 5 lb mini sledge hammer and make all the kindling you'll ever need or want. SAVE YOUR FINGERS!! Just wear gloves, the kindling of oak and hickory have very small sharp splinters.
customer_reviews.author: Techtester1

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I am a 70 year old woman, who with my husband, heat exclusively with wood. We live in northern Maine. I have never chopped kindling because I am a klutz and was always afraid of chopping off a hand/finger(s), etc. BUT, I saw this product, read the reviews and yesterday cut a HUGE pile of kindling--no problem. I LOVE it. I'm getting it for my son/daughter(s) in laws so they keep their hands and digits safe!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Best splitter I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: This is a rare product that works exactly as described and works well. This splitter is impressive in its simplicity and effectiveness. I am 62 and of average build and strength I suppose, and I split a quarter cord of firewood in no time at all with no sweat. Came back an hour later and did the rest leaving me with a half cord of what is basically double-split firewood, and I still can't believe how easy it was. If you have firewood you want to double-split, or create kindling, get this.
customer_reviews.author: Jhome

customer_reviews.title: Quality and functionality- take a whack!
customer_reviews.text: When my hubby unwrapped this for Christmas he was a bit skeptical. He tried it out on the deck and thought it had potential. He had a friend bolt it to a large log so it couldn’t move. Now he loves it. Everyone wants to take a whack at it. A four pound mallet makes it simple work. Making kindling is easy and fun!
customer_reviews.author: RockyB

customer_reviews.title: So fast, safe and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Brought it to a family camp trip, where "Mark" (also around 60 yo) poo poo'd it and said all he needs is his hatchet. The contest lasted about a minute before it was clear my production far exceeded his. He conceded that for where you can bring one, (I.e., not on a back packing trip) it was far superior for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Sharonna

customer_reviews.title: Simple and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: For my campfire wood, this device is perfect for me. I didn't need a powered splitter because i only burn occasionally. This is sturdy if it's on a solid base. It takes large logs and continues to perform as it was designed. You can't really do any damage to it. It's a hefty, cast, one piece tool that sits outside in all weather and is a great addition to my collection of stuff
customer_reviews.author: Rich B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for making larger logs into kindling without splitting first
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the smaller kindling cracker and was limited by the size of wood I could split. This unit is much larger and will be used more often. It saves running smaller logs through a splitter before using which is ideal for me as I burn wood to heat my home in the winter time (700 Sq Ft). The cracker provides the correct size pieces to burn and regulate the heat in my home. The price being roughly 50% off the regular prices was my motivation for buying this when I did. .
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hillyer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to split wood for our fire pit, and so much safer.  LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what it says it will - splits wood easily and safely. It's very sturdy and stable, and it doesn't take much strength to get the wood to split. It is expensive upfront, but it's so well made that I expect it to last a lifetime. I'm thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dynette

customer_reviews.title: Best kindling Cracker
customer_reviews.text: My son was telling me that the cored of wood he bought did not come with any kindling and it's becoming expensive to buy kindling. I had bought this Kindling Cracker for myself in November and love it. I had not bought him a Christmas present yet, so guess what he got. I ordered him the Kindling Cracker, Glove and a Mallet. He loves his new Christmas present.
customer_reviews.author: Steve House

customer_reviews.title: Back saver
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to use to split smaller logs. Saves your back and is worth the $. We needed something to split smaller logs into small pieces for a smoker. This worked great.
customer_reviews.author: TexanInIndy

customer_reviews.title: At the Age of 75 even I can split wood with this
customer_reviews.text: This is so solid that one doesn't think twice about using a sledge hammer to split the piece of wood inserted in the holder. And at he age of 75, and a woman, even I can split wood. When not using it I would recommend you keep it safe and secure. It's that good.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I use the Kindling Cracker XL to make smaller pieces out of larger logs, go figure. The top opening is large enough to accommodate my needs. All it takes is a couple whacks of a small sledge hammer to split the wood into the exact size needed. If it is still too large, just keep putting it into the opening and hammer until the wood is the size kindling you need. I secured the Cracker onto a flat top of a tree stump with 4 lag screws and washers.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful. What a great invention!
customer_reviews.text: My son used to use an ax to chop wood for his urban pizza over. I always worried about his fingers. He’s a musician and his hands are all important to his profession. He also has a puppy who bounces around the wood. This product is fantastic. My son loves it and I am glad he’s chopping more safely. Thanks for inventing this. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: NiniS

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny. Get the XL.
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for 2 years now. It’s well worth it. Use at least a 4lb sledge to get the value from it. I’m old but I can swing something heavier than that and the heavier the better for quick splitting. Great item and safe to use even for a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Sister Mary

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! My wife wanted us to get this so she cold split firewood after I had rotator cuff surgery on my shoulder. I can also use it with my good arm. We're pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Eric F.

customer_reviews.title: XL Kindling Cracker is taller and larger diameter so even more useful than original
customer_reviews.text: I have used the smaller size for four years to create kindling. I just bought the larger size to split off bark and soft edge wood from larger sections of logs that I split with my Chopper, another great product. The Kindling Cracker products are easier to use and safer than using a hatchet or axe.
customer_reviews.author: bobinmass

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it! A must!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today and put it to the test! It passed with flying colors! Easy to use, and didn’t bounce about when I struck the wood. The blade was sharper then I thought, which was nice. I can’t recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Westcott

customer_reviews.title: Had no idea how handy this item would be
customer_reviews.text: Obviously the name implies it is a kindling splitter, be in my case it takes moderate size wood and gives me a place to make the logs smaller and more accommodating to my small wood burning insert. It is really handy and almost fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Forwood

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this for my father-in-law as he has a bad back and recently has had hip replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father-in-law as he has a bad back and recently has had hip replacement. However, that doesn’t stop him from killing himself at the cabin and hunting property... This has absolutely saved time, physical strain on your body, and not to mention we get free readily work from the kids as this is something that they can use as well. For anybody wondering my children are 8 and 13 we’ve had as young as a five-year-old using this with adult supervision of course. It was well worth the extra money to go with the larger kindling splitter!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H

customer_reviews.title: Great product but needs better packaging
customer_reviews.text: Great para products is that it takes no time to fill a trashcan up Kindling. Issue is that the packaging is less than desirable but it is a sturdy cast-iron product also when ordering this kindling cracker you need a 19 inch round to mount it to and 4 3/8 x 2“ lags with 3/8 washers to mount it to the round
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Ryder

customer_reviews.title: My husband LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: We have the XL size. The primary kindling maker (my husband) says this kindling splitter is "fantastic, works great". We debated which size to get. We now know the smaller size would not have worked for us - it would not have allowed our 14" - 16" logs to fit in. With this tool he is able to take our regular wood stove wood and put it through the splitter to create kindling. Before this it was lots of work with an ax.
customer_reviews.author: suemarga

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and safe to use!
customer_reviews.text: So easy and safe to use. I am a middle aged woman with severe arthritis. I used to leave the kindling making to my handyman, but disliked having to be dependent that way. With this, I now have no problems whatsoever making my own kindling, and have no worries about my arthritic hands while doing so. Love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: Safe, time saving, and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly an amazing device. Hard to believe man has been splitting wood for thousands of years and this just came out. I purchased the larger model and it is safe, clean, and very easy to use. Having fire places and a wood stove I buy a lot of pre-split wood, but many of the pieces are too big for ease of use and need to be split again. Just place the piece in this splitter, smack it with a decent hammer and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: A great tool to have!
customer_reviews.text: Our son recommended the Kindling Cracker to us. I immediately ordered one and have used the it almost daily since receiving it three weeks ago. I have demonstrated how it works to several of my friends and they were so impressed they intend to order one for themselves as well. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: JODY L COWEN

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Wish I had got one earlier!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Wish I had thought to get one years ago. I buy split firewood but then for my pizza oven need to make lots of smaller kindling sized pieces. I used to spend a lot of time doing this on a stump with a splitting axe/maul. This is so much better than that in every way. Faster/easier/safer. I use a small 3lbs sledge with this.
customer_reviews.author: EJO

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever for splitting wood
customer_reviews.text: Best invention ever for splitting wood, so much easier and safer than a splitting maul. Heavy duty and built to last forever. Highly recommend the King (XL) size, you can still split small pieces with this, but you can't split larger pieces with the small Cracker!
customer_reviews.author: A. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Glad we bought the larger size - it isn't as big as it looks still - but a perfect size for our 16" lengths. Split a load of kindling without having to dodge the hatchet!
customer_reviews.author: Fubeca

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best purchase we have made in a long time. It’s cut splitting kindling time in half. It’s very easy to use and doesn’t require an axe. I would suggest a sturdy mallet though. Highly recommend! Buying another one for my dad for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia F.

customer_reviews.title: Safety first😁
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. So much safer than splitting with a maul. Typically 2-3 solid whacks with a handheld sledge hammer and the wood splits nice and easy. Can make pieces really small too something you can’t do swinging a maul. Build is solid, won’t rip over. Blade is plenty sharp to jam wood on and keep it standing for subsequent hammer strikes. Split wood falls off and away allowing a new piece to be put on in rapid succession.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Pieces larger in diameter of course are a no go, as is the ones that are almost equal in height. It does need to be secured - as of right now I step on the corner as I split the wood - no injuries to date :-) With some thicker pieces, ones that have a knot, I use the cracker as a base and use a metal splitter and sledge hammer to split the wood. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this simple, heavy-duty product. Where's it been the last 30 yrs. I've been doing it the hard way. This is not for "log-splitting", I still need my splitter for busting up trunk-wood, etc. but this ideal for breaking into smaller pieces and especially for cracking kindling to start of fire or boost the wood stove from coals in the morning to full burn.
customer_reviews.author: Cincy Kid

customer_reviews.title: The best thing since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: What a miracle this thing is! No more trying to find small pieces of wood to start a fire, we can just make our own! I would recommend a long handled 4+ pound sledge hammer to make the job go easier, but any sledge will do. This cuts wood like butter!
customer_reviews.author: Summer C.

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: We have a wood burner that we use everyday. This is easy for me to create kindling with whatever size log I start with. It does not take much strength to split the wood and I don't have to worry about losing a hand or foot if I miss.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Works great. You'll need to buy a heavy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. You'll need to buy a heavy, 'Thor'-like hammer to smack the logs to split. If you need a log splitter, this is a good one
customer_reviews.author: WonderWoman15

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kindling and for splitting small logs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on the great reviews. The Cracker is excellent! We use it primarily for 5" to 8" logs that we have from tornado damage. I don't think we could recommend this enough. Great quality product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Makes splitting kindling a breeze. Four or five good whacks and the deed is done! The blade is just sharp enough that you can position a piece of wood on top of it and it will stay steady even if it's not touching the sides of the ring.
customer_reviews.author: Maria DiFi

customer_reviews.title: Performs exactly as it should
customer_reviews.text: Performs exactly as I wanted it to. Maybe a bit pricey for cast iron, but it feels strong and heavy. The blade has a nice edge on it, not to the point where it would slice you if you touched it, but sharp enough to do its job easily.
customer_reviews.author: Marty T.

customer_reviews.title: Splits wood well
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it will do. Make sure you get at least a 4 lb hammer if you are going to split wood. Some of the pieces get stuck sometimes and it rusted big time when I left it outside one night during the rain. Overall. 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kroos

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and safer than traditional tools
customer_reviews.text: Love this. So much easier than using an axe, safer as well. I have arthritis in my shoulder and I am able to split wood to a useable size without aggravating my shoulder
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We love this. My husband tends to injure himself while chopping wood/kindling, so this is a perfect solution to that problem. We got the XL version to fit more logs. It's heavy, sturdy, and the blade is nice and sharp. GREAT find!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I’m very impressed with the quality and durability and ease of use. I recommend you bolt it down to a stump. That makes it easier to use. Great invention.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Sandler

customer_reviews.title: I would not burn wood without one.
customer_reviews.text: We used this all last winter before reviewing. As described, anyone can make kindling with this. Fits well with my antique fireplace tools, heirloom quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gadget. Ripped through a pile of major logs in no time with very little effort leaving a neat bunch of kindling sized wood. Real life saver and no nagging from the wife about axe safety. Really impress. If you need to split wood you need one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mapke005

customer_reviews.title: I am a one armed wood stove owner and I needed THIS
customer_reviews.text: I can't use my right arm very well now so I needed something to split kindling that didn't require dexterity. This is IT! I don't have to say anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to use as videos would convince you. But way better than using an ax or wedge. I just use a heavy sledgehammer and it's been working flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Not a serious splitter.
customer_reviews.text: I've got 16 inch long 5 inch diameter maple logs to split. It simply doesn't get the job done. I am back to a splitting mall. I wasted a hundred bucks on this thing. Cumbersome and ineffective On hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: CW Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: As described, split wood can be split into kindling size pieces with much less effort than with a mall. Not able to swing a mall after surgery. This tool and a four pound hammer did the job. Safe, easy to use, and stable. I put it on my chopping block and confidently split straight grained ash, oak, and maple easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N.

customer_reviews.title: CAREFULL
customer_reviews.text: Great Tool! Wear leather gloves!!! My husband on first use went to ER...cut his knuckle - Oh ... 8 Stiches. Over Thanksgiving. No matter he loves the way it makes kindling.
customer_reviews.author: margaret titus

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! My husband and I are both older folks (he is 75) and we have been splitting by hand for years. It's been difficult lately to get through the more dense stuff. This does a great job. We got the biggest one offered, so we would have more options for use. We also mounted it on one of our original splitting stumps to make sure it was secured.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Miller

customer_reviews.title: Get it if you burn a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I burn 2-3 cords per season & harvesting my own wood. Using scraps that would accumulate from the maul to start a fire would help but burn quickly. This provided the ability to split awkward pieces into great kiddling. If you burn a lot, you’ll really like it. Also value the old school craftsmanship & cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Decker

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant product! With this and a 3 pound mallet, I can easily split logs for the fire pit. Even my 77 year old friend has a blast splitting wood using this product. It's super easy to use and it's so rewarding to whack the log and see it split in two.
customer_reviews.author: LTB123

customer_reviews.title: Makes short work of creating fun size logs !
customer_reviews.text: Best of hundreds of Amazon products I've ordered. Lovely. fun to use. Makes short work of making fun size logs before the fire works up to biggie size.
customer_reviews.author: K. Demsky

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT design!!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE it!! We purchased it for our AirBnB cabin guests. It is SOOO easy to use. Worth every penny. Be aware, you need to use it on a concrete foundation. We found the little cabin's back porch not stable enough. One design flaw, no holes in the cast iron to attach to a foundation.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Oddly Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This splitter is amazing! It is so easy to use that my nine year old grandson can make kindling with no problem. It's so impressive, I bought one for a friend. Cannot recommend it enough!
customer_reviews.author: Dougkap

customer_reviews.title: EASY
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and quite safe. Solid build. Great investment for anyone who likes campfires, fireplaces, or wood burning ovens, etc
customer_reviews.author: JRK

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well, if you do your part
customer_reviews.text: I like this splitter. Much safer than trying to hold wood with one hand and swinging a hatchet with the other. Very well made. You may want to put a protective sleeve around the sledge handle where it might sometimes smack the top ring.
customer_reviews.author: Whut?

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Such a simple design that can’t be better, outstanding craftsmanship and works amazingly . Who needs a log splitter???? This is all you need.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Neat product which is helpful for me to use in the garage where space is limited and I don’t want wood flying all over from chopping it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Love love it
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, it does what it is supposed to do. A heavy hammer is a must, I used a 3lb hammer. I had lots of cut wood for our firepit and I used this to break down the larger pieces into perfect kindling. Can't wait to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Postcardlady

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: We use this kindling cracker every day that we use our fireplace. It is extremely easy to use and an excellent value for the money. It is much safer than using a hatchet to make kindling. This kindling cracker would be fantastic to take on Truck camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Simison

customer_reviews.title: This works great! Might even buy one for a Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: I am SURE that I have reviewed this before, but it keeps asking! We use a lot of wood and we but it split, but that isn't always the size you think it should be. This works great! Might even buy one for a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: DI Bassett

customer_reviews.title: An obvious advance in firewood preparation
customer_reviews.text: Splitting firewood is never a pleasant chore. Two friends independently told me about this product, and it lives up to its reputation. I just had a massive dead oak tree taken down, and this item has made processing the wood into usable sizes so much easier. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: stillafan

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas present for my husband. He loves it and it works great! The neighbors even come over to borrow it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Along with making kindling, I use it to break up some small/medium sized logs too. It's so much easier than using a splitter!
customer_reviews.author: pkarandi

product_meta.title: Kindling Cracker XL King Firewood Splitter - Kindling Splitter Wood Splitter Wood Splitting Wedge Manual Log Splitter Wedge
feature_bullets: A safe and easy way to make kindling with no moving blade or sharpened object passing by your hands
Splits firewood with less force than a standard axe
9in. inside dia. top ring offers more space than the original model to handle large pieces of firewood
17in. height allows you to split long pieces of firewood

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.9 out of 5 stars814 ratings4.9 out of 5 stars
